item.title: Ticket #1804 (Reduce Kubrick custom header queries to one) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: All Kubrick settings are saved as an array in a single option. Custom functions handle caching and updating. Reduces queries by about 3 per Kubrick page load. Automatically upgrades old-style options on first page load.

item.title: Ticket #1803 (Setting the GMT Offset in 1.6 Alpha-2) created
item.dc:creator: EnderatEros
item.description: When trying to change the GMT offset using the WP-Admin interface, it would not let me. When looking to see why, I noticed the installer script didn't create a row for the gmt_offset. I added that manually and set the appropriate values to make it work.

item.title: Ticket #1765 (Simplify and standardize anchor syntax) updated
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description:
Keywords changed

After some research it seems that all version 5+ browsers support linking to elements with an id. However, the ​HTML 4 Spec states that id should only be used on non-A elements. That is, if you're going to use A elements, use <a name="..." />.

This is only necessary if we're looking to support anchor linking in NN4 or other archaic browsers. This isn't crucial functionality and I think we've broken compatibility in enough other areas that it makes sense to just use the <x id="..."> format, where x is some element like a header.
